intro: Jacquemontia rondonii, commonly known as the Rondonia cupid, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, with heart-shaped leaves and hairy stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
